commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1261580

Change-Id: Ieeace91e8cbd540ddccd8288002331a6e5a70c58

commit_message:
Revert to previous status if volume busy on delete

Currently when deleting a volume and it is busy, the manager will set
the status to 'available', even if the volume was in an error state. The
solution here is to save the previous state in the volume's
admin_metadata, and set to that.

Change-Id: Ic1eaf95424b874ab9a89058dd32c37dda17efd5b
Closes-Bug: #1236165

commit_message:
ValueError should use '%' instead of ','

ValueError do not support using ',' to connect log and variables,
we should use '%' instead.

Change-Id: I04c2002a970465d8250e5550f6bf992b48845a0d
Closes-Bug: #1261621

commit_message:
Move workspace setup to functions.sh

And add a test script that exercises the logic of the git repo
checkout functions.  Current test errors are annotated and commented
out.

Change-Id: I2e04787999a64cd8aaa238ce0374898032a9d8bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/56/63956/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright (C) 2011-2013 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. function function_exists { type $1 2>/dev/null | grep -q 'is a function' } # Attempt to fetch a git ref for a project, if that ref is not empty function git_fetch_at_ref { local project=$1 local ref=$2 if [ "$ref" != "" ]; then git fetch $ZUUL_URL/$project $ref return $? else # return failing return 1 fi } function git_checkout { local project=$1 local branch=$2 local reset_branch=$branch if [[ "$branch" != "FETCH_HEAD" ]]; then reset_branch="remotes/origin/$branch" fi git checkout $branch git reset --hard $reset_branch if ! git clean -x -f -d -q ; then sleep 1 git clean -x -f -d -q fi } function git_has_branch { local project=$1 # Project is here for test mocks local branch=$2 if git branch -a |grep remotes/origin/$branch>/dev/null; then return 0 else return 1 fi } function git_prune { git remote prune origin } function git_remote_update { # Attempt a git remote update. Run for up to 5 minutes before killing. # If first SIGTERM does not kill the process wait a minute then SIGKILL. # If update fails try again for up to a total of 3 attempts. MAX_ATTEMPTS=3 COUNT=0 until timeout -k 1m 5m git remote update; do COUNT=$(($COUNT + 1)) echo "git remote update failed." if [ $COUNT -eq $MAX_ATTEMPTS ]; then exit 1 fi SLEEP_TIME=$((30 + $RANDOM % 60)) echo "sleep $SLEEP_TIME before retrying." sleep $SLEEP_TIME done } function git_remote_set_url { git remote set-url $1 $2 } function git_clone_and_cd { local project=$1 local short_project=$2 if [[ ! -e $short_project ]]; then echo " Need to clone $short_project" git clone https://git.openstack.org/$project fi cd $short_project } function fix_etc_hosts { # HPcloud stopped adding the hostname to /etc/hosts with their # precise images. HOSTNAME=`/bin/hostname` if ! grep $HOSTNAME /etc/hosts >/dev/null; then echo "Need to add hostname to /etc/hosts" sudo bash -c 'echo "127.0.1.1 $HOSTNAME" >>/etc/hosts' fi } function fix_disk_layout { # HPCloud and Rackspace performance nodes provide no swap, but do # have ephemeral disks we can use. HPCloud also doesn't have # enough space on / for two devstack installs, so we partition the # disk and mount it on /opt, syncing the previous contents of /opt # over. if [ `grep SwapTotal /proc/meminfo | awk '{ print $2; }'` -eq 0 ]; then if [ -b /dev/vdb ]; then DEV='/dev/vdb' elif [ -b /dev/xvde ]; then DEV='/dev/xvde' fi if [ -n "$DEV" ]; then sudo umount ${DEV} sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mklabel msdos sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary linux-swap 0 8192 sudo parted ${DEV} --script -- mkpart primary ext2 8192 -1 sudo mkswap ${DEV}1 sudo mkfs.ext4 ${DEV}2 sudo swapon ${DEV}1 sudo mount ${DEV}2 /mnt sudo rsync -a /opt/ /mnt/ sudo umount /mnt sudo mount ${DEV}2 /opt fi fi } # do all the zuulification magic for project at a specified branch # # The basic logic flow is as follows: # if we have ``branch`` for project, check that out # if we don't have ``branch`` for project, change ``branch`` to master # and check that out # if the global ZUUL_BRANCH matches ``branch``, then also look for a # valid ZUUL_REF, and use that instead of the HEAD of the branch # # The end result is a tree on disk checked out at the right ref for zuul function setup_project { local project=$1 local branch=$2 local short_project=`basename $project` echo "Setting up $project @ $branch" git_clone_and_cd $project $short_project git_remote_set_url origin https://git.openstack.org/$project if [ -n "$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH" ] ; then OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$branch,$OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH,") fi # Update git remotes git_remote_update # Ensure that we don't have stale remotes around git_prune # See if this project has this branch, if not, use master FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF="" if ! git_has_branch $project $branch; then branch=master FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF=$(echo $ZUUL_REF | sed -e "s,$branch,master,") fi # See if we should check out a Zuul ref if [ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "$branch" ]; then # See if Zuul prepared a ref for this project if git_fetch_at_ref $project $OVERRIDE_ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $ZUUL_REF || \ git_fetch_at_ref $project $FALLBACK_ZUUL_REF; then # It's there, so check it out. git_checkout $project FETCH_HEAD else if [ "$project" == "$ZUUL_PROJECT" ]; then echo "Unable to find ref $ZUUL_REF for $project" exit 1 fi git_checkout $project $branch fi else # We're ignoring Zuul refs git_checkout $project $branch fi } function re_exec_devstack_gate { export RE_EXEC="true" echo "This build includes a change to devstack-gate; re-execing this script." exec $WORKSPACE/devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh } function setup_workspace { local base_branch=$1 local DEST=$2 # Enabled detailed logging, since output of this function is redirected set -o xtrace fix_disk_layout sudo mkdir -p $DEST sudo chown -R jenkins:jenkins $DEST # The vm template update job should cache the git repos # Move them to where we expect: if ls ~/workspace-cache/*; then rsync -a ~/workspace-cache/ $DEST/ fi echo "Using branch: $base_branch" for PROJECT in $PROJECTS; do cd $DEST setup_project $PROJECT $base_branch done # It's important we are back at DEST for the rest of the script cd $DEST # The vm template update job should cache some images in ~/files. # Move them to where devstack expects: if [ "$(ls ~/cache/files/* 2>/dev/null)" ]; then rsync -a ~/cache/files/ $DEST/devstack/files/ fi # Disable detailed logging as we return to the main script set +o xtrace } function select_mirror { if [ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_REQS_INTEGRATION" -eq "0" ]; then ORG=$(dirname $ZUUL_PROJECT) SHORT_PROJECT=$(basename $ZUUL_PROJECT) $DEVSTACK_GATE_SELECT_MIRROR $ORG $SHORT_PROJECT sudo cp ~/.pydistutils.cfg ~root/.pydistutils.cfg sudo cp ~/.pydistutils.cfg ~stack/.pydistutils.cfg sudo chown stack:stack ~stack/.pydistutils.cfg sudo cp ~/.pydistutils.cfg ~tempest/.pydistutils.cfg sudo chown tempest:tempest ~tempest/.pydistutils.cfg sudo -u stack mkdir -p ~stack/.pip sudo -u root mkdir -p ~root/.pip sudo -u tempest mkdir -p ~tempest/.pip sudo -u root cp ~/.pip/pip.conf ~root/.pip/pip.conf sudo cp ~/.pip/pip.conf ~stack/.pip/pip.conf sudo chown stack:stack ~stack/.pip/pip.conf sudo cp ~/.pip/pip.conf ~tempest/.pip/pip.conf sudo chown tempest:tempest ~tempest/.pip/pip.conf fi } function setup_host { # Enabled detailed logging, since output of this function is redirected set -o xtrace # This is necessary to keep sudo from complaining fix_etc_hosts # Move the PIP cache into position: sudo mkdir -p /var/cache/pip sudo mv ~/cache/pip/* /var/cache/pip # Start with a fresh syslog sudo stop rsyslog sudo mv /var/log/syslog /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo mv /var/log/kern.log /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo touch /var/log/syslog sudo chown /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/syslog sudo touch /var/log/kern.log sudo chown /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/kern.log sudo start rsyslog # We set some home directories under $BASE, make sure it exists. sudo mkdir $BASE # Create a stack user for devstack to run as, so that we can # revoke sudo permissions from that user when appropriate. sudo useradd -U -s /bin/bash -d $BASE/new -m stack TEMPFILE=`mktemp` echo "stack ALL=(root) NOPASSWD:ALL" >$TEMPFILE chmod 0440 $TEMPFILE sudo chown root:root $TEMPFILE sudo mv $TEMPFILE /etc/sudoers.d/50_stack_sh # Create a tempest user for tempest to run as, so that we can # revoke sudo permissions from that user when appropriate. # NOTE(sdague): we should try to get the state dump to be a # neutron API call in Icehouse to remove this. sudo useradd -U -s /bin/bash -d $BASE/new/tempest -m tempest TEMPFILE=`mktemp` echo "tempest ALL=(root) NOPASSWD:/sbin/ip" >$TEMPFILE echo "tempest ALL=(root) NOPASSWD:/sbin/iptables" >>$TEMPFILE chmod 0440 $TEMPFILE sudo chown root:root $TEMPFILE sudo mv $TEMPFILE /etc/sudoers.d/51_tempest_sh # Future useradd calls should strongly consider also updating # ~/.pip/pip.conf and ~/.pydisutils.cfg in the select_mirror function if # tox/pip will be used at all. # If we will be testing OpenVZ, make sure stack is a member of the vz group if [ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_VIRT_DRIVER" == "openvz" ]; then sudo usermod -a -G vz stack fi if [ -f $DEVSTACK_GATE_SELECT_MIRROR ] ; then select_mirror fi # Disable detailed logging as we return to the main script set +o xtrace } function cleanup_host { # Enabled detailed logging, since output of this function is redirected set -o xtrace cd $WORKSPACE # No matter what, archive logs # Sleep to give services a chance to flush their log buffers. sleep 2 sudo cp /var/log/syslog $WORKSPACE/logs/syslog.txt sudo cp /var/log/kern.log $WORKSPACE/logs/kern_log.txt mkdir $WORKSPACE/logs/rabbitmq/ sudo cp /var/log/rabbitmq/* $WORKSPACE/logs/rabbitmq/ mkdir $WORKSPACE/logs/sudoers.d/ sudo cp /etc/sudoers.d/* $WORKSPACE/logs/sudoers.d/ sudo cp /etc/sudoers $WORKSPACE/logs/sudoers.txt if [ -d $BASE/old ]; then mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/logs/old/ mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/logs/new/ mkdir -p $WORKSPACE/logs/grenade/ sudo cp $BASE/old/screen-logs/* $WORKSPACE/logs/old/ sudo cp $BASE/old/devstacklog.txt $WORKSPACE/logs/old/ sudo cp $BASE/old/devstack/localrc $WORKSPACE/logs/old/localrc.txt sudo cp $BASE/logs/* $WORKSPACE/logs/ sudo cp $BASE/new/grenade/localrc $WORKSPACE/logs/grenade/localrc.txt NEWLOGTARGET=$WORKSPACE/logs/new else NEWLOGTARGET=$WORKSPACE/logs fi sudo cp $BASE/new/screen-logs/* $NEWLOGTARGET/ sudo cp $BASE/new/devstacklog.txt $NEWLOGTARGET/ sudo cp $BASE/new/devstack/localrc $NEWLOGTARGET/localrc.txt sudo iptables-save > $WORKSPACE/logs/iptables.txt df -h> $WORKSPACE/logs/df.txt pip freeze > $WORKSPACE/logs/pip-freeze.txt # Process testr artifacts. if [ -f $BASE/new/tempest/.testrepository/0 ]; then sudo cp $BASE/new/tempest/.testrepository/0 $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt sudo python /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/subunit2html.py $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt $WORKSPACE/testr_results.html sudo gzip -9 $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt sudo gzip -9 $WORKSPACE/testr_results.html sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt.gz $WORKSPACE/testr_results.html.gz sudo chmod a+r $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt.gz $WORKSPACE/testr_results.html.gz elif [ -f $BASE/new/tempest/.testrepository/tmp* ]; then # If testr timed out, collect temp file from testr sudo cp $BASE/new/tempest/.testrepository/tmp* $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt sudo gzip -9 $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt.gz sudo chmod a+r $WORKSPACE/subunit_log.txt.gz fi if [ -f $BASE/new/tempest/tempest.log ] ; then sudo cp $BASE/new/tempest/tempest.log $WORKSPACE/logs/tempest.log fi # Make sure jenkins can read all the logs sudo chown -R jenkins:jenkins $WORKSPACE/logs/ sudo chmod a+r $WORKSPACE/logs/ rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/* rename 's/(.*)/$1.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/sudoers.d/* rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/rabbitmq/* mv $WORKSPACE/logs/rabbitmq/startup_log \ $WORKSPACE/logs/rabbitmq/startup_log.txt # Remove duplicate logs rm $WORKSPACE/logs/*.*.txt if [ -d $BASE/old ]; then rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/old/* rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/new/* rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/grenade/* rm $WORKSPACE/logs/old/*.*.txt rm $WORKSPACE/logs/new/*.*.txt fi # Compress all text logs find $WORKSPACE/logs -iname '*.txt' -execdir gzip -9 {} \+ find $WORKSPACE/logs -iname '*.dat' -execdir gzip -9 {} \+ # Save the tempest nosetests results sudo cp $BASE/new/tempest/nosetests*.xml $WORKSPACE/ sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $WORKSPACE/nosetests*.xml sudo chmod a+r $WORKSPACE/nosetests*.xml # Disable detailed logging as we return to the main script set +o xtrace }

commit_message:
update SecurityGrpoup

Change-Id: Ia68692934ee98b84eeee4325615b29691306fcb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/55/63855/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.objects import security_group_rule as security_group_rule_obj security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.ensure(context) group = security_group_obj.SecurityGroup(user_id=context.user_id, project_id=context.project_id, name=name, description=description) try: group.create(context) return group security_group.name = name security_group.description = description security_group.save(context, columns_to_join) return security_group return security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get_by_name(context, return security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get(context, id) groups.append(security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get_by_name( context, context.project_id, name)) groups.append(security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get(context, id)) groups = security_group_obj.SecurityGroupList.get_all(context) else: groups = security_group_obj.SecurityGroupList.get_by_project( context, groups = security_group_obj.SecurityGroupList.get_by_project( context, project) if security_group.in_use(context): security_group.destroy(context) def is_associated_with_server(self, security_group, instance): groups = instance['security_groups'] if not groups: for group in groups: if (group['id'] == security_group['id']): security_group = security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get_by_name(context, if self.is_associated_with_server(security_group, instance): if isinstance(instance, instance_obj.Instance): instance.add_security_group(context, security_group) else: instance['security_groups'].append(security_group) self.db.instance_add_security_group(context.elevated(), instance_uuid, security_group['id']) security_group = security_group_obj.SecurityGroup.get_by_name(context, if not commit_message:
Support MTU configuration of L3 managed interfaces

network_device_mtu configure the MTU for L3 managed network interfaces.
By default no specific network_device_mtu configuration is set. The
interface defaults will be used as they got created.

This options allows configuration of Jumbo Frame usage.

Change-Id: Ic5de813532b744fcd5ee289f10fb28e587b3699f

commit_message:
Fix for qemu-nbd hang

Do a lazy un-mount (-l during umount) and disable the
host cache when creating the qemu-nbd connection. This
combination seems to avoid the hangs we see in the
tempest runs. The symptom seen in the logs was if
there was a problem during a previous unmount (say /dev/nbd6)
then a subsequent mount with the same device will hang.

Closes-Bug: #973413
Partial-Bug: #1254890

Change-Id: I0f9d034d18b71ef27593a0030f8edc43573f61e5

commit_message:
default_network changes for overcloud

These are the changes I needed to make to get the default_network
change working in my tripleo overcloud.  With this, all of the
tests that were previously failing due to the multiple available
networks problem are working again.

The changes themselves are:

Tweaked the XML server create so it only adds the fixed_ip
attribute if there is a fixed ip.

default_network was overriding the networks passed in some tests,
so I changed it to check if the kwarg exists before setting it.

Change-Id: Ib8d78360612ef554ca80ce4e779672b03356b6e0

commit_message:
Fix OS_TEST_PATH in .testr.conf

As of commit 87f772c0bd59790aa43de59938d9c138963f9f4e the default
value for OS_TEST_PATH as set in .testr.conf is no longer valid.

In addition, because shell variables are evaluated in a
somewhat unintuitive order in situations like this, the default
wasn't being used properly anyway.  See link below for an
explanation why:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10938483/bash-specifying-environment-variables-for-echo-on-command-line

This commit fixes both problems.

Change-Id: I8eec146a21eab656cb48b9e23a92a9da52246269
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/63847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: OS_TEST_PATH=${OS_TEST_PATH:-./tempest} \ ${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover -t ./ $OS_TEST_PATH $LISTOPT $IDOPTION

commit_message:
Add `port` attribute to Server object

Ssh server can run not only on tcp port 22. Also removed unused
attribute `uuid`.

bug 1261754

Change-Id: I1832ac5549960c2d1661510dbb728e0372a92230

Blacklist boto 2.21.1

boto, and the euca2ools commands work again when switching back to boto
2.21.0.

Related-Bug: #1263824

2.21.0.

commit_message:
Change default eswitchd port to avoid conflict

Previous default for eswitch/daemon_endpoint would set a TCP port (5001)
which is in the range of the well known ports.
Change to unreserved port (60001) will avoid that conflict.

Change-Id: I711c4659f497e44a6041ec9958835c1f2f4174a7
Closes-Bug: #1245885
(cherry picked from commit cd542a7f1f2ea21d3694e70b8e6a6db0efbd3a01)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/63897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rename dynamic_ui package and normalize it.

* Move muranodashboard.environments.services package to
  muranodashboard.dynamic_ui.
* Move all code from dynamic_ui/__init__.py to dynamic_ui/services.py
  thus having normal empty __init__.py for dynamic_ui package (as in
  other packages).

Change-Id: I395ee621578cb417314fe4960d74108deb848023

commit_message:
Fix ssh port in devstack engine

When changing user from root to DEVSTACK_USER, ssh port has
been dropped.

Closes-Bug: #1261751

Change-Id: I1c5face4f00624f59f06a6c39c050350d5489db3

commit_message:
Add `parent` field to deploy object

This is necessary for engines which doing subdeploys.

blueprint multihost-deploy

Change-Id: Ibf2ea78863c36f7fddcde8d9bb46d2855482bb6d

added_lines: def test_deployment_list_parent(self): deploy = db.deployment_create({}) subdeploy1 = db.deployment_create({'parent': deploy.uuid}) subdeploy2 = db.deployment_create({'parent': deploy.uuid}) self.assertEqual([deploy.uuid], [d.uuid for d in db.deployment_list()]) subdeploys = db.deployment_list(parent=deploy.uuid) self.assertEqual(set([subdeploy1.uuid, subdeploy2.uuid]), set([d.uuid for d in subdeploys]))

commit_message:
Do not check the status of a job execution if Oozie id is None

New job executions may not have an Oozie id assigned right away.
Skip the periodic status update for such jobs until the Oozie id
is no longer None.

Closes-Bug: #1263785
Change-Id: I26da336ff52962c1644ceba641428d2311950377

commit_message:
Don't provide default values to properties.get()

The properties of a resource are known, so we don't need to provide
default values to properties.get().

Change-Id: I2c28d9fe41db589a885c458dba35780aabed87c0

deleted_lines: key_name = self.properties.get('KeyName', None)

commit_message:
Remove useless validate methods

Remove the validate methods of s3 and swift resources, as they don't
provide any value and hide validation of properties.

Change-Id: I5b9f7aef828d5e4d7cdebfd2bd550feaae545c90
Closes-Bug: #1260643

commit_message:
Moved tests for general utils out of vanilla package

test_utils are used by tests for general code. They should not be in 'vanilla' package.
The next logical step is to split "tests for utils" and "utils for tests".
But at least tests better reflect to objects structure now.

Change-Id: I0adb77d8c55893ae74eb4a73dd7fb69c82ebe9bb

commit_message:
Provide warnings about CLI usage

Provide an 'CLI Introduction' section with warning about careful usage.
Add a note about how to not ruin all your environment with Fuel CLI.

Change-Id: I4b67013fa35209b9263989c70163860a165c6f84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/68/63668/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. index:: Understanding Environment deployment with Fuel CLI .. _cli_usage: Understanding Environment deployment with Fuel CLIIntroduction ------------ Fuel CLI tool is a powerful tool that allows you: * Operate with environments using text console only * Modify some kind of internal data directly which you can't do via Web UI * Avoid some data verifications which are doing by Web UI logic Also Fuel CLI is a dangerous tool and you can easily break your environment with it. That is why you should use it carefully. fuel node --node-id 2 --disk --upload .. note:: To protect yourself from sudden errors, please, follow these simple rules: * Make a backup of all configuration before you start modifying it * If you remove something from a configuration file, be absolutely sure you don't need it; Fuel CLI don't merge a new data with previous one - it just completely overwrite an old data with a new one * Keep in mind that if you upload any changes in ``provisioning`` or ``deployment`` operations, you will freeze the whole environment configuration - any changes with networks, cluster settings or disk configurations will have no effect; in order to modify such parameters you will need to change appropriate section of each node configuration
deleted_lines: .. index:: Fuel UI: Network Configuration Understanding Environment deployment with Fuel-CLI fuel node --node-id 2 --disk --upload

commit_message:
Keystone ADMIN_TOKEN autogenerated

If the user doesn't enter one using Debconf, then the Debian
package will automatically generate a ADMIN_TOKEN. This
needed to be properly documented, which is what this patch
does.

Change-Id: Ide85feb9c7bae233563a653c2be0a85609e33697
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/97/63797/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>If you do not enter a password using debconf (if you just hit enter with an empty string, or if you install keystone using the Debconf non-interactive mode), then a random ADMIN_TOKEN will be generated by the package.</para>

commit_message:
Added new OSTF tests for Murano 0.4

Added OSTF tests for new Murano services:
 Demo Service (simple service based on CentOS image)
 Apache Service (Linux-based service)
 Telnet Service (Linux-based service)

Also fixed logic for image search to support different
Murano images types.

Fixed issue with changed windows images tag.

Change-Id: Ief56732f450f6ed14f47b70e82e04957a7770c17
Implements: blueprint new-ostf-tests-for-murano04

deleted_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from savanna.conductor import resource as r from savanna import exceptions as ex from savanna.service import volumes_heat as volumes from savanna.tests.unit import base as models_test_base class TestAttachVolume(models_test_base.DbTestCase): @mock.patch('savanna.service.instances._get_node_group_image_username') def test_mount_volume(self, p_get_username): p_get_username.return_value = 'root' instance = self._get_instance() execute_com = instance.remote().execute_command self.assertIsNone(volumes._mount_volume(instance, '123', '456')) self.assertEqual(execute_com.call_count, 3) execute_com.side_effect = ex.RemoteCommandException('cmd') self.assertRaises(ex.RemoteCommandException, volumes._mount_volume, instance, '123', '456') def test_get_device_paths(self): instance = self._get_instance() execute_com = instance.remote().execute_command partitions = """major minor #blocks name 7 0 41943040 vdd 7 1 102400000 vdc 8 0 976762584 vda 8 1 842576896 vdb""" execute_com.return_value = (0, partitions) with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): volumes._get_device_paths(instance, 5) paths = volumes._get_device_paths(instance, 3) self.assertSequenceEqual(paths, ['/dev/vdb', '/dev/vdc', '/dev/vdd']) @mock.patch('savanna.service.volumes_heat._get_device_paths') @mock.patch('savanna.service.volumes_heat._mount_volume') def test_attach_to_instances(self, p_mount, p_get_paths): p_get_paths.return_value = ['/dev/vda, /dev/vdb', '/dev/vdc'] p_mount.return_value = None instance1 = {'instance_id': '123', 'instance_name': 'inst_1'} instance2 = {'instance_id': '456', 'instance_name': 'inst_2'} ng = {'volumes_per_node': 2, 'volumes_size': 2, 'volume_mount_prefix': '/mnt/vols', 'instances': [instance1, instance2]} cluster = r.ClusterResource({'node_groups': [ng]}) instances = cluster.node_groups[0].instances volumes.mount_to_instances(instances) self.assertEqual(p_get_paths.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(p_mount.call_count, 4) def _get_instance(self): inst_remote = mock.MagicMock() inst_remote.execute_command.return_value = 0 inst_remote.__enter__.return_value = inst_remote inst = mock.MagicMock() inst.remote.return_value = inst_remote return inst

commit_message:
Add timeout for ceph recovery

When user destroy osd-node from cluster,
ceph requires ~5 min for recovering.

Improvement for ceph_ha test.

Change-Id: I6e12223ca6602d82182323c8b264c787c43e0f04

commit_message:
Fixed AMQP configuration steps for Block Storage

I fixed the AMQP configuration steps in cinder.conf for Block Storage
on both controller and service nodes. I also unified structure and
phrasing with other portions of the guide and mentioned replacing
'RABBIT_PASS'. This patch affects all distributions.

I also found and fixed a minor issue causing several database
configuration instructions for other distributions to leak into those
for Debian which uses Debconf.

Change-Id: Ifd6f185b422195a00aad6efa83418d34b93eac85
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1244781

commit_message:
Improve behaviour of the Galera rebuild.

Decreasing timeout down to moment of quorum creation for corosync.

Join to healthy cluster takes about 20 seconds.

Change-Id: I46b887b626269d8d8905ef78bee3b20f7d1a5e3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/29/62929/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - sleeping under majority of quorum is up to continue or just try to rebuild cluster after five # minutes a bit less conditionally for i in $(seq 1 60); do crm status | grep -q 'partition with quorum' if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then break else sleep 5 fi done # Allow recently joined nodes to fire up mysql process, 5 seconds from inside start() and 5 seconds for process itself sleep 10 sleep 5
deleted_lines: # - five minutes are enough for man who turns servers in the rack and for crm to push significant # percentage of the epoch values to the shared resource and not too large for such type of disaster at all. sleep 300 sleep 10

While it is just a copy of the netaddress regexp, they may diverge later
and users should be able to continue using the appropriate one.

Change-Id: Ib6d96113f16fc5f4dc4b8918d2409d08e317a47d
Closes-Bug: #1262786

commit_message:
Fix copying of select-mirror outputs.

The Jenkins user was attempting to write to ~stack and failing because
it does not have permission to do so. Use more sudo to get around that.
Additionally move the fix for /etc/hosts into setup_host instead of
setup_workspace. This will make the use of sudo quieter as it will be
able to resolve $HOSTNAME earlier.

Change-Id: I8e6bd821ceac9d0614c068dc7ce7a6657329d84c

commit_message:
Increase memory size for slaves

New components (like heat) are actively using swap,
we should increase mem.size for improvement of deployment.

Change-Id: Ia5a3ddafc62ae3e6c0464be73fe9c30dce035de1

commit_message:
ml2/type driver: race on reserve_provider_segment

There is a race on inserting row into table when reserve_provider_segment()
Fix it by utilizing primary key constraint instead of table locking.

Change-Id: Id162b4fa2fc5d82efa089c901e3525ffc97e6999
Closes-Bug: #1260598
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/22/61922/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.openstack.common.db import exception as os_exc try: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): try: alloc = (session.query(GreAllocation). filter_by(gre_id=segmentation_id). with_lockmode('update'). one()) if alloc.allocated: raise exc.TunnelIdInUse(tunnel_id=segmentation_id) LOG.debug(_("Reserving specific gre tunnel %s from pool"), segmentation_id) alloc.allocated = True except sa_exc.NoResultFound: LOG.debug(_("Reserving specific gre tunnel %s " "outside pool"), segmentation_id) alloc = GreAllocation(gre_id=segmentation_id) alloc.allocated = True session.add(alloc) except (os_exc.DBError, os_exc.DBDuplicateEntry) as e: if isinstance(e.inner_error, sa_exc.IntegrityError): raise exc.TunnelIdInUse(tunnel_id=segmentation_id) raise
deleted_lines: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): try: alloc = (session.query(GreAllocation). filter_by(gre_id=segmentation_id). with_lockmode('update'). one()) if alloc.allocated: raise exc.TunnelIdInUse(tunnel_id=segmentation_id) LOG.debug(_("Reserving specific gre tunnel %s from pool"), segmentation_id) alloc.allocated = True except sa_exc.NoResultFound: LOG.debug(_("Reserving specific gre tunnel %s outside pool"), segmentation_id) alloc = GreAllocation(gre_id=segmentation_id) alloc.allocated = True session.add(alloc)

revisions:

THIS IS WIP

Summary of changes:
- Added selection of datastores of "vsan" type
- Added image import via HttpNfc. HttpNfc is the only viable

  temporary datastore storage.
- Added support for new vmdk format 'streamOptimized'
  It is a compact, compressed streamable sparse format that is well-suited as a
  vmdk glance image format.  Just as important, this is the only format that
  HttpNfc supports, so it is the required format for deploying to VSAN
- Basic handling image caching as an imported VM instead of a disk
- Handle instance delete of vsan-based VM differently (through the more
  straightforward Delete_Task)

TODOs:
- Fix/add unit tests.
- Implement nova snapshot->glance upload of VSAN VM root disk via httpnfc

Known issue:
- instance delete will delete attached volumes as well. This is being
  addressed in another fix I believe via detaching before delete
- need to add unit tests
- streamOptimized image caches different on the datastore due to the
  different import mechanism, so there will be coordination with the
  upcoming image cache management work.

commit_message:
VMware: Fix VSAN datastores cannot be used

THIS IS WIP
(probably will have to break it up into a few smaller patches)

Summary of changes:
- Added selection of datastores of "vsan" type.
- Added image import via HttpNfc. HttpNfc is the only viable means to import a
  disk to a vSAN datastore in the absence of any other temporary datastore
  storage.
- Implemented nova snapshot->glance upload of vSAN VM root disk via HttpNfc
- Added support for new vmdk format 'streamOptimized'.
  It is a compact, compressed streamable sparse format that is well-suited as a
  vmdk glance image format.  Just as important, this is the only format that
  HttpNfc supports, so it is the required format for deploying to vSAN
- Handling of image caching as an imported VM instead of a disk
- Handle instance delete of vsan-based VM differently (through the more
  straightforward Delete_Task)

TODOs:
- Add unit tests.

Known issue:
- Instance delete will delete attached volumes as well. This is being
  addressed in another fix.
- StreamOptimized image caches differently on the datastore due to the
  different import mechanism, so there will be additional coordination with the
  upcoming image cache management work.

Closes-Bug: #1244752
Change-Id: I0aca0525c91e4001b4bf14216e7be1fbf026fb13

commit_message:
xen: add namespace for diagnostics (v3 API only)

There is no formal definition for the VM diagnostics. For the
V2 API the diagnostics will be returned as they are today. For the V3
api the diagnostics will be prefixed with the driver namespace.

That is the diagnostics will be returned as follows:
{'xen': {'key1': 'value1',
         'key2': 'value2',
         ...}}

This will support backward compatibility with the existing API's.

Part of the blueprint diagnostics-namespace

DocImpact

Change-Id: I37fbf9ac9fa1afe6086121692a83b9178d2cb7db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/61525/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added ability to specify kernel command line for an instance

The KernelCommandLine extension provides ability to specify the kernel
command line as a property of a glance image.  This value is then
used as the kernel command line for nova instances started using this
glance image.  This extension also allows the command line to be
specified through the nova REST api for creating instances.

Change-Id: I4564f32d2d279d54f5da82da33731956d2f76184

commit_message:
Remove oslo uuidutils.generate_uuid call from nova

uuidutils.generate_uuid is going to be removed from oslo, so we
need to remove the call from nova code.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-November/
018980.html

This patch create new method in our nova utils to wrap the
uuid.uuid4() methods.

Change-Id: I4506696d50669f16810d4c7c2cd9d21b78bf1f4d
Partial-Bug: #1253497
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/57588/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuid as stdlib_uuid req, str(stdlib_uuid.uuid4()), body)
deleted_lines: import uuid req, str(uuid.uuid4()), body)

commit_message:
Benchmark scenarios for Rally: Nova server metadata

The patch provides Rally with the basic Nova benchmark scenario for server
metadata: the scenario implements setting and deleting a set of fake metadata
records for a prepared server.

Blueprint benchmark-scenarios

Change-Id: I9f61d5f11d176ba654c8a0280ad8bf547f7d9336

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from rally.benchmark.scenarios.nova import server_metadata from rally import test from tests.benchmark.scenarios.nova import test_utils class NovaServerMetadataTestCase(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_fake_metadata(self): for length in [8, 16, 32, 64]: meta = server_metadata.NovaServerMetadata._fake_metadata(length) self.assertTrue(isinstance(meta, dict)) self.assertEqual(len(meta), length) def test_set_and_delete_meta(self): N = 10 fake_server = object() fake_meta = server_metadata.NovaServerMetadata._fake_metadata(N) osclients = "rally.benchmark.base.osclients" with mock.patch(osclients) as mock_osclients: mock_osclients.Clients.return_value = test_utils.FakeClients() keys = ["admin_username", "admin_password", "admin_tenant_name", "uri"] kw = dict(zip(keys, keys)) server_metadata.NovaServerMetadata.class_init(kw) ctx = {"prepared_server": fake_server} servers = ("rally.benchmark.scenarios.nova.server_metadata." "NovaServerMetadata.nova.servers") with mock.patch(servers) as mock_servers: server_metadata.NovaServerMetadata.set_and_delete_meta(ctx, N) expected = [ mock.call.set_meta(fake_server, fake_meta), mock.call.delete_meta(fake_server, fake_meta.keys()) ] self.assertEqual(mock_servers.mock_calls, expected)

subject: Introduce Generic Parsing/Filtering Framework
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-21 21:48:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-loganalyze/commit/9a3b3985c740b3c36b2f16c507b8cb3b687c5a11', 'message': "Introduce Generic Parsing/Filtering Framework

This commit introduces a new, generic framework for writing
log prettifiers.  LogMatchers parse or filter log line parts,
and are chained together to form full matchers.  The output of
these chains (a dict or nested dicts) is passed into an outputter,
which applies styles to the output.  Outputters delegate the actual
details of how a style is applied to stylers.  This way, a single
set of matchers and a single outputter can be used regardless of
the output medium.  Only the styler has to be differed.

The WSGI filter has been updated to use the new framework, and common
code between the passthrough filter and the html filter has been
pulled out into its own method which constructs the appropriate filter
chains.

The framework includes several filters which take arguments, and thus
the following query string parameters have been introduced:

- filter_sev: used to explicitly override the automatic severity
              detection.  When not specified, the filter checks
              whether a level has been specified in the query
              string (which acts like 'filter_sev=True').  If
              no level is present, it falls back on the
              filename-based detection.

- log_type: used to explicitly override the log file type detection.
            if not specified, the filename-based detection will be used.
            May be 'console', 'keystone', 'devstack', or 'oslo'

- no_match (default: false): explicitly disables matching/filtering functionality
                             for the passthrough filter, in case you
                             just want the log file directly for some
                             reason

- skip_raw (default: true): skip lines the 'raw' AMQP message lines,
                            when appropriate

- skip_source (multiple): skip lines whose 'source' matches the given
                          regular expression (note that spaces are
                          treated as '+' in the regexp, so use '\s'
                          for a space instead).

This is commit 2/4

Change-Id: Iffb6b7366c64cdef6f7657ecab64caaede6af882
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-11-26 20:24:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-loganalyze/commit/d6709b39bc6989227365bf8fc12cc01d2365574b', 'message': "Introduce Generic Parsing/Filtering Framework

This commit introduces a new, generic framework for writing
log prettifiers.  LogMatchers parse or filter log line parts,
and are chained together to form full matchers.  The output of
these chains (a dict or nested dicts) is passed into an outputter,
which applies styles to the output.  Outputters delegate the actual
details of how a style is applied to stylers.  This way, a single
set of matchers and a single outputter can be used regardless of
the output medium.  Only the styler has to be differed.

The WSGI filter has been updated to use the new framework, and common
code between the passthrough filter and the html filter has been
pulled out into its own method which constructs the appropriate filter
chains.

The framework includes several filters which take arguments, and thus
the following query string parameters have been introduced:

- filter_sev: used to explicitly override the automatic severity
              detection.  When not specified, the filter checks
              whether a level has been specified in the query
              string (which acts like 'filter_sev=True').  If
              no level is present, it falls back on the
              filename-based detection.

- log_type: used to explicitly override the log file type detection.
            if not specified, the filename-based detection will be used.
            May be 'console', 'keystone', 'devstack', or 'oslo'

- no_match (default: false): explicitly disables matching/filtering functionality
                             for the passthrough filter, in case you
                             just want the log file directly for some
                             reason

- skip_raw (default: true): skip lines the 'raw' AMQP message lines,
                            when appropriate

- skip_source (multiple): skip lines whose 'source' matches the given
                          regular expression (note that spaces are
                          treated as '+' in the regexp, so use '\s'
                          for a space instead).

- skip_blanks (default: true): skip lines which contain nothing but

commit_message:
Introduce Generic Parsing/Filtering Framework

This commit introduces a new, generic framework for writing
log prettifiers.  LogMatchers parse or filter log line parts,
and are chained together to form full matchers.  The output of
these chains (a dict or nested dicts) is passed into an outputter,
which applies styles to the output.  Outputters delegate the actual
details of how a style is applied to stylers.  This way, a single
set of matchers and a single outputter can be used regardless of
the output medium.  Only the styler has to be differed.

The WSGI filter has been updated to use the new framework, and common
code between the passthrough filter and the html filter has been
pulled out into its own method which constructs the appropriate filter
chains.

The framework includes several filters which take arguments, and thus
the following query string parameters have been introduced:

- filter_sev: used to explicitly override the automatic severity
              detection.  When not specified, the filter checks
              whether a level has been specified in the query
              string (which acts like 'filter_sev=True').  If
              no level is present, it falls back on the
              filename-based detection.

- log_type: used to explicitly override the log file type detection.
            if not specified, the filename-based detection will be used.
            May be 'console', 'keystone', 'devstack', or 'oslo'

- no_match (default: false): explicitly disables matching/filtering functionality
                             for the passthrough filter, in case you
                             just want the log file directly for some
                             reason

- skip_raw (default: true): skip lines the 'raw' AMQP message lines,
                            when appropriate

- skip_source (multiple): skip lines whose 'source' matches the given
                          regular expression (note that spaces are
                          treated as '+' in the regexp, so use '\s'
                          for a space instead).

This is commit 2/4

Change-Id: Iffb6b7366c64cdef6f7657ecab64caaede6af882
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-loganalyze refs/changes/84/57784/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: 'DEBUG': 2906, # there is curiousness in the fact that keystone logs have a lot # of blank lines, so INFO is higher than you think it should be 'INFO': 15131, 'DEBUG': 46071, 'INFO': 4388, 'DEBUG': 46912, gen = self.get_generator(fname, level=level, html=False)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 08:53:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b727fec19d241ceb85c4f0526900944c28b9fbff', 'message': 'Make libvirt ephemeral storage cache type configurable

commit_message:
Make libvirt ephemeral storage cache type configurable

The cache type used for volume storage is configurable since long,
but we did not have an option for the ephemeral storage.

The "none" cache type does not have the best performance with every
storage setup, however it provides the best chances to survive a power
outage.
Let the users the pick cache type which fits to their requirements.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3b03862a1037b931948c8c464cbebc67fe3538f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/60178/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Cache type for ephemeral storage. When ephemeral_cache is # not specified, we try to pick a safe one. (string value) #ephemeral_cache=<None>

commit_message:
Simplify security group search logic

This will also speed up search since encoding is moved out of the
the loop. Also, getting all security groups is done only once.
The code to check if multiple matches are found is dead since
nova does not allow creating multiple security groups with same name
Thus there is no need to write another test to check NoUniqueMatch
exception.

Closes-Bug: #1254945

Change-Id: I0185116a60b2c5214f13f6b999683bbae8708e9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/28/58428/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: encoding = (locale.getpreferredencoding() or sys.stdin.encoding or 'UTF-8') groups = cs.security_groups.list() matches = [group for group in groups if secgroup == group.name.encode(encoding)] if len(matches) > 1: msg = ("Multiple security group matches found for name" " '%s', use an ID to be more specific." % secgroup) raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch(msg) elif len(matches) == 0: else: return matches[0]
deleted_lines: match_found = False for s in cs.security_groups.list(): encoding = (locale.getpreferredencoding() or sys.stdin.encoding or 'UTF-8') s.name = s.name.encode(encoding) if secgroup == s.name: if match_found != False: msg = ("Multiple security group matches found for name" " '%s', use an ID to be more specific." % secgroup) raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch(msg) match_found = s if match_found is False: return match_found

commit_message:
Vol-transfer Creation doesn't support 'name' via xml

Volume-transfer creation can specify the 'name' param.
That's true via json format, everything's ok.
But when you create it via xml format, the 'name' param is not effective.

The problem caused by the deserializer.

But the cinderclient uses 'name' param, so this modification will effect the cin
 derclient..
If I change the 'display_name' to 'name' in xml deserializer,
 that won't need to midify the cinderclient.

I checked the original codes of api & db for v-transfer,
 it seems that 'display_name' should be the desired/correct one.

So I incline to modify it like this.

Fixes bug: 1243613

Change-Id: I05e41739edb8bcc2a6d677f22d11b07bf36b99a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/63/62163/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = transfer.get('display_name', None)
deleted_lines: name = transfer.get('name', None)

commit_message:
Allow setting Keystone API version in service catalog

This is the first step toward removing the Identity API version from the
Service Catalog, by setting IDENTITY_API_VERSION="" in local.conf
no version is added to the Identity Service Catalog URLs.

This _will_ break the current clients but is useful for testing
API version discovery.

Change-Id: I4870cddcb75488b3b6837a15b063aa69cdcc1444
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/68/62468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ``IDENTITY_API_VERSION`` is the API version # ``KEYSTONE_API_VERSION`` is the string used to configure Keystone (has 'v' in it) # This monstrosity allows us to set _no_ API version in the service catalog # with ``IDENTITY_API_VERSION=""`` KEYSTONE_API_VERSION=${KEYSTONE_API_VERSION:-${IDENTITY_API_VERSION:+v${IDENTITY_API_VERSION}}}
deleted_lines: # Identity API version export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=${IDENTITY_API_VERSION:-2.0}

subject: Fixes invalid error message when uploading objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-06 01:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/004b609a2eb9bbfa2694f3e9ba01ae7fd3806bf2', 'message': "Fixes invalid error message when uploading objects

Swift client reports error when uploading object with a
non-admin user with correct write ACL. Error is reported
due to the fact that before attempting to upload, swift
will attempt to put a container in case it doesn't exist.

When the container already exists, it will just report an
expected error for non-admin users, because they don't
have the necessary ACLs to perform a HEAD on containers.

This fix just ignores the 403 error to not confuse non-admin
users.

Closes-Bug: 1204558
Change-Id: I0e1bc2f475beda954af39d680454f37435fc2d6a
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes invalid error message when uploading objects

Swift client reports error when uploading object with a
non-admin user with correct write ACL. Error is reported
due to the fact that before attempting to upload, swift
will attempt to put a container in case it doesn't exist.

When the container already exists, it will just report an
expected error for non-admin users, because they don't
have the necessary ACLs to perform a HEAD on containers.

This fix just ignores the 403 error to not confuse non-admin
users.

Closes-Bug: 1204558
Change-Id: I0e1bc2f475beda954af39d680454f37435fc2d6a
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/00/60400/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not (err.http_status == 403): msg = ' '.join(str(x) for x in (err.http_status, err.http_reason)) if err.http_response_content: if msg: msg += ': ' msg += err.http_response_content[:60] thread_manager.error( 'Error trying to create container %r: %s', args[0], msg)
deleted_lines: msg = ' '.join(str(x) for x in (err.http_status, err.http_reason)) if err.http_response_content: if msg: msg += ': ' msg += err.http_response_content[:60] thread_manager.error( 'Error trying to create container %r: %s', args[0], msg)

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 01:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/eb9c878252d3e2c4ed3db482b8a51480c03aa66a', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using
the "--pre" option which is the default in tox. "--pre" means
"Include pre-release and development versions." By default, pip will
only install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior
we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/12/62212/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = Trueusedevelop = True install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}filename=*.py,trove-*
deleted_lines: filename=*.py,trove-*

commit_message:
Failsafe wsgi logging

In the event of wsgi logging failure, write the traceback
to the syslog.

Change-Id: Ic5050808a04d8c34613be9a965f3c2031ddf621f
Partial-Bug: #1054501
Co-Authored-By: Arathi<arathi_darshanam@persistent.co.in>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/80/61180/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys import unittestfrom webob import Request from cinder.api.middleware.fault import FaultWrapper from cinder.api.middleware.fault import run_oncefrom cinder.openstack.common import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger('cinder.api.middleware.fault') class APITest(test.TestCase): def _wsgi_app(self, inner_app): # simpler version of the app than fakes.wsgi_app return FaultWrapper(inner_app) def test_traceback_iter(self): @webob.dec.wsgify def succeed(req): return 'Succeeded' api = self._wsgi_app(succeed) try: raise test.TestingException except Exception: expected = 'TestingException' self.assertEqual(expected, list(api._traceback_iter(*sys.exc_info()))[-1]) def test_fail_safe(self): @webob.dec.wsgify def fail(req): raise test.TestingException("Threw an exception") api = self._wsgi_app(fail) self.err = '' def append_err(arg): self.err += arg api._fallback_handle = append_err def one_over_zero(*args, **kwargs): 1 / 0 LOG.exception = one_over_zero resp = Request.blank('/').get_response(api) self.assertTrue('{"computeFault' in resp.body, resp.body) self.assertEqual(resp.status_int, 500, resp.body) self.assertTrue("Threw an exception" in self.err) self.assertTrue("ZeroDivisionError" in self.err) class RunOnceTest(unittest.TestCase): def test_run_once(self): @run_once def add_one(arg): return arg + 1 val = 0 val = add_one(val) self.assertEquals(val, 1) val = add_one(val) self.assertTrue(val is None)

commit_message:
add/removeTenantAccess throws 500 Error in v2 api

The function addTenantAccess and removeTenantAccess don't check whether
the parameter "tenant" is in request body. So the 500 error has been
thrown. Modify the code, to throw 400(HttpBadRequest).

Change-Id: I1fe864f948732c8ca2d976f6727d2087459ed6fc
Closes-Bug: 1253014

commit_message:
Clean-up minor English grammar

Fixes to Tempest Coding Guide include eliminating
spurious "the"s, inserting "is" and "to", fixing
hanging paragraph indents due to leading spaces,
making tenses match, eliminating sentence run-ons,
etc..

Change-Id: I23a0619bad8663bacd6ae33f23fcc7321cb03870

In every error or failure situation we should provide as much error-relatedTry to avoid using ``try`` blocks in test cases. Both the ``except`` and ``finally`` blocks could replace the original exception, if additional operations lead to another exception. subject: Fix a race condition about IPAvailabilityRange
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-22 11:46:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/df107f369fdd025b0bd7be55591d57c3add3cad0', 'message': "Fix a race condition about IPAvailabilityRange

If there are multiple neutron-servers concurrently
executing allocate/free ip call, a race condition
can occur.
Suppose that I have 2 neutron-servers running,
one gets a request to allocate 192.168.1.16 and
the other gets a request to free 192.168.1.15.
Both servers are going to generate UPDATEs to the
DB, they will look something like this:
SERVER 1: UPDATE ipavailabilityranges SET first_ip
   = '192.168.1.17' WHERE first_ip = '192.168.1.16'
SERVER 2: UPDATE ipavailabilityranges SET first_ip
   = '192.168.1.15' WHERE first_ip = '192.168.1.16'

One solution is to use distributed lock,
unfortunately, oslo doesn't have this feature now.
We had to resort to the database, using long
transaction combinating with 'select for update'
to lock the whole table to ensure two transaction
are excuted linearly insteading of setting
transaction isolation level serializable.
'select for update' will work well with left
join in postgresql as well since all fields of
ipallocationpools are not null (can refer 1191653).

BTW, exsiting unittest has covered this case.

Change-Id: Ia06df25dec40f6ab3ec61c3db9bb9c343c1f4193
Closes-Bug: #1214115

commit_message:
Fix a race condition about IPAvailabilityRange

If there are multiple neutron-servers concurrently
executing allocate/free ip call, a race condition
can occur.
Suppose that I have 2 neutron-servers running,
one gets a request to allocate 192.168.1.16 and
the other gets a request to free 192.168.1.15.
Both servers are going to generate UPDATEs to the
DB, they will look something like this:
SERVER 1: UPDATE ipavailabilityranges SET first_ip
   = '192.168.1.17' WHERE first_ip = '192.168.1.16'
SERVER 2: UPDATE ipavailabilityranges SET first_ip
   = '192.168.1.15' WHERE first_ip = '192.168.1.16'

One solution is to use distributed lock,
unfortunately, oslo doesn't have this feature now.
We had to resort to the database, using long
transaction combinating with 'select for update'
to lock the whole table to ensure two transaction
are excuted linearly insteading of setting
transaction isolation level serializable.
'select for update' will work well with left
join in postgresql as well since all fields of
ipallocationpools are not null (can refer 1191653).

BTW, exsiting unittest has covered this case.

and there is no doubt that table lock will have a
certain influence on the performance, but it should
be the most important before finding a better way.

Change-Id: Ia06df25dec40f6ab3ec61c3db9bb9c343c1f4193
Closes-Bug: #1214115

subject: Refactor FloatingIPCheckTracker in basic network scenario test
revisions:

Move floating IP check to base class manager.NetworkScenarioTest.

Change-Id: I33850b67d22e1acac208d2007854bddb05cbc94d

commit_message:
Refactor FloatingIPCheckTracker in basic network scenario test

Move floating IP check to base class manager.NetworkScenarioTest.
Do the floating IP check as soon as the floating IP
created to server.

Change-Id: I33850b67d22e1acac208d2007854bddb05cbc94d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/38/62838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from tempest.openstack.common import jsonutilsimport tempest.testclass FloatingIPCheckTracker(object): """ Checking VM connectivity through floating IP addresses is bound to fail if the floating IP has not actually been associated with the VM yet. This helper class facilitates checking for floating IP assignments on VMs. It only checks for a given IP address once. """ def __init__(self, compute_client, floating_ip_map): self.compute_client = compute_client self.unchecked = floating_ip_map.copy() def run_checks(self): """Check for any remaining unverified floating IPs Gets VM details from nova and checks for floating IPs within the returned information. Returns true when all checks are complete and is suitable for use with tempest.test.call_until_true() """ to_delete = [] loggable_map = {} for check_addr, server in self.unchecked.iteritems(): serverdata = self.compute_client.servers.get(server.id) ip_addr = [addr for sublist in serverdata.networks.values() for addr in sublist] if check_addr.floating_ip_address in ip_addr: to_delete.append(check_addr) else: loggable_map[server.id] = check_addr for to_del in to_delete: del self.unchecked[to_del] LOG.debug('Unchecked floating IPs: %s', jsonutils.dumps(loggable_map)) return len(self.unchecked) == 0 def _wait_for_floating_ip_association(self): ip_tracker = FloatingIPCheckTracker(self.compute_client, self.floating_ips) self.assertTrue( tempest.test.call_until_true( ip_tracker.run_checks, self.config.compute.build_timeout, self.config.compute.build_interval), "Timed out while waiting for the floating IP assignments " "to propagate") self._wait_for_floating_ip_association()

commit_message:
test 3 date format in functional tests

According to HTTP/1.1, servers MUST accept all three formats:

Sun, 06 Nov 1994 08:49:37 GMT     # RFC 822, updated by RFC 1123
Sunday, 06-Nov-94 08:49:37 GMT    # RFC 850, obsoleted by RFC 1036
Sun Nov 6 08:49:37 1994           # ANSI C's asctime() format

In functional tests, a date value header has 3 kinds of format will be
tested.

Change-Id: I679ed44576208f2a79bffce787cb55bda4b39705
Closes-Bug: #1253207
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/92/57592/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.time_old = time.strftime("%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT", time.gmtime(time.time() - 86400)) cls.time_new = time.strftime("%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S GMT", time.gmtime(time.time() + 86400))
deleted_lines: cls.time_old = time.asctime(time.localtime(time.time() - 86400)) cls.time_new = time.asctime(time.localtime(time.time() + 86400))

Use create_router_interface and create_port

Use create_router_interface and create_port in setUpClass
Correct some typo

Change-Id: I1b4e9a72259e0af5271cfe6caf9a3b16e7ad3938

added_lines: Neutron: v2.0 of the Neutron API is assumed. It is also assumed that the following cls.router = cls.create_router(data_utils.rand_name('router-'), external_network_id=cls.ext_net_id) cls.create_router_interface(cls.router['id'], cls.subnet['id']) port = cls.create_port(cls.network) cls.port.append(port) created_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['tenant_id']) self.assertIsNotNone(created_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(created_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[0]['id']) self.assertEqual(created_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], created_floating_ip['id']) shown_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['id'], created_floating_ip['id']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['tenant_id'], created_floating_ip['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['floating_ip_address'], created_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(shown_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[0]['id']) self.assertIn(created_floating_ip['id'], floatingip_id_list) created_floating_ip['id'], port_id=self.port[1]['id']) updated_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertEqual(updated_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[1]['id']) self.assertEqual(updated_floating_ip['fixed_ip_address'], self.port[1]['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address']) self.assertEqual(updated_floating_ip['router_id'], self.router['id']) created_floating_ip['id'], port_id=None) updated_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertIsNone(updated_floating_ip['port_id']) self.assertIsNone(updated_floating_ip['fixed_ip_address']) self.assertIsNone(updated_floating_ip['router_id'])
deleted_lines: Quantum: v2.0 of the Quantum API is assumed. It is also assumed that the following cls.router = cls.create_router( data_utils.rand_name('router-'), external_network_id=cls.network_cfg.public_network_id) resp, _ = cls.client.add_router_interface_with_subnet_id( cls.router['id'], cls.subnet['id']) resp, port = cls.client.create_port(cls.network['id']) cls.port.append(port['port']) cls.client.remove_router_interface_with_subnet_id(cls.router['id'], cls.subnet['id']) for i in range(2): cls.client.delete_port(cls.port[i]['id']) def _delete_floating_ip(self, floating_ip_id): # Deletes a floating IP and verifies if it is deleted or not resp, _ = self.client.delete_floating_ip(floating_ip_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) # Asserting that the floating_ip is not found in list after deletion resp, floating_ips = self.client.list_floating_ips() floatingip_id_list = list() for f in floating_ips['floatingips']: floatingip_id_list.append(f['id']) self.assertNotIn(floating_ip_id, floatingip_id_list) create_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertIsNotNone(create_floating_ip['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(create_floating_ip['tenant_id']) self.assertIsNotNone(create_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(create_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[0]['id']) self.assertEqual(create_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], self.addCleanup(self._delete_floating_ip, create_floating_ip['id']) create_floating_ip['id']) show_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertEqual(show_floating_ip['id'], create_floating_ip['id']) self.assertEqual(show_floating_ip['floating_network_id'], self.assertEqual(show_floating_ip['tenant_id'], create_floating_ip['tenant_id']) self.assertEqual(show_floating_ip['floating_ip_address'], create_floating_ip['floating_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(show_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[0]['id']) self.assertIn(create_floating_ip['id'], floatingip_id_list) create_floating_ip['id'], port_id=self.port[1]['id']) update_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertEqual(update_floating_ip['port_id'], self.port[1]['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(update_floating_ip['fixed_ip_address']) self.assertEqual(update_floating_ip['router_id'], self.router['id']) create_floating_ip['id'], port_id=None) update_floating_ip = floating_ip['floatingip'] self.assertIsNone(update_floating_ip['port_id']) self.assertIsNone(update_floating_ip['fixed_ip_address']) self.assertIsNone(update_floating_ip['router_id'])

commit_message:
Serialize plurals correctly in neutron xml client

'fixed_ips' and others were incorrectly serialized as dict instead
of arrays

Change-Id: Id50039d158d3f547d72296064a2187fbf90831fe
Closes-Bug: #1255969
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/29/59029/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def parse_array(node): array = [] for child in node.getchildren(): array.append(xml_to_json(child)) return array def xml_to_json(node, plurals=None): if plurals is not None and tag in plurals: json[tag] = parse_array(child) else: json[tag] = xml_to_json(child)
deleted_lines: def xml_to_json(node): json[tag] = xml_to_json(child)

commit_message:
Added ceilometer-anotification to enabled services

Added ceilometer-anotification to enabled services for the master branch
It's necessary for the correct work of ceilometer after merge:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58600/

Change-Id: Ida6440c2682c2b12dc8d4572a4d2a828e83c9f75

subject: Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-10 16:37:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ecb9cdcb968735355a6bb69b1e36b73d1bc85b42', 'message': 'Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status

Previously, DHCP notifications for which active agents could not
be found were silently dropped.  This change ensures that
notifications are sent to scheduled agents even if those agents do
not appear to be active.  Further, notifications for which an
active agent can not be found will result in an exception.

This change is required because the Neutron service, when under
load, may not be able to process agent heartbeats in a timely
fashion and will then incorrectly presume that a given agent is
down.

It is safe to send a notification to an agent erroneously reported
as being down, and subsequent patches will ensure that it is safe
to send a notification to an agent that is actually down.

Closes-bug: #1192381
Change-Id: Id3e639d9cf3d16708fd66a4baebd3fbeeed3dde8
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-11 05:39:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b81dc07f58b76d10a7df445622564f87b824247d', 'message': 'Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status

The Neutron service, when under load, may not be able to process
agent heartbeats in a timely fashion.  This can result in
agents being erroneously considered inactive.  Previously, DHCP
notifications for which active agents could not be found were
silently dropped.  This change ensures that notifications are
sent to scheduled agents even if those agents do not appear to
be active.

Additionally, if no agent is scheduled for a given network, an
error will be logged.  Raising an exception might be
preferable, but has such a large testing impact that it will be
submitted as a separate patch if deemed necessary.

Closes-bug: #1192381
Change-Id: Id3e639d9cf3d16708fd66a4baebd3fbeeed3dde8

commit_message:
Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status

The Neutron service, when under load, may not be able to process
agent heartbeats in a timely fashion.  This can result in
agents being erroneously considered inactive.  Previously, DHCP
notifications for which active agents could not be found were
silently dropped.  This change ensures that notifications for
a given network are sent to agents even if those agents do not
appear to be active.

Additionally, if no enabled dhcp agents can be found for a given
network, an error will be logged.  Raising an exception might be
preferable, but has such a large testing impact that it will be
submitted as a separate patch if deemed necessary.

Partial-bug: #1192381
Change-Id: Id3e639d9cf3d16708fd66a4baebd3fbeeed3dde8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/68/61168/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import contextlib import mock import testtools from neutron.api.rpc.agentnotifiers import dhcp_rpc_agent_api from neutron.common import exceptions from neutron.common import utils from neutron import manager from neutron.tests import base class TestDhcpAgentNotifyAPI(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestDhcpAgentNotifyAPI, self).setUp() self.notify = dhcp_rpc_agent_api.DhcpAgentNotifyAPI() def _test_notification(self, agents_by_status): with contextlib.nested( mock.patch.object(manager.NeutronManager, 'get_plugin'), mock.patch.object(utils, 'is_extension_supported'), mock.patch.object(self.notify, '_get_dhcp_agents')) \ as (m1, m2, mock_get_dhcp_agents): mock_get_dhcp_agents.side_effect = [ agents_by_status.get(True), agents_by_status.get(None), ] self.notify._notification(mock.Mock(), 'foo', {}, 'net_id') def test_notification_sends_cast_for_agent(self): with mock.patch.object(self.notify, 'cast') as mock_cast: self._test_notification({True: (('foo', 'bar'),)}) self.assertEqual(mock_cast.call_count, 1) def test_notification_raises_exception_for_no_agent(self): with testtools.ExpectedException(exceptions.NoDhcpAgentForNetwork): self._test_notification({True: None}) def test_notification_logs_warning_and_sends_cast_for_inactive_agent(self): with mock.patch.object(self.notify, 'cast') as mock_cast: with mock.patch.object(dhcp_rpc_agent_api.LOG, 'warning') as mock_warn: self._test_notification({None: (('foo', 'bar'),)}) self.assertEqual(mock_warn.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(mock_cast.call_count, 1)

Creating network resources before the agents start with the ml2

commit_message:
Neutron: create network resources when agents are started

Creating network resources before the agents start with the ml2
plugin might result in bnding failures for some resources such as
DHCP ports because the resources are created before the agents
report to the server.

This patch should ensure all agents have started and reported
their state to the server before creating network resources.

Change-Id: Ifafb73bd3c5409a555a573ad9a94b96d79061c38
Related-Bug: #1253896

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy module

Changes -
 * Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
 * Add docstring for exception handlers of session
 * Removal of _REPOSITORY global variable.
 * Remove string.lowercase usage
 * Database hook enabling traditional mode at MySQL
 * Replace xrange in for loop with range
 * SQLAlchemy error patterns improved
 * Remove unused import
 * Correct invalid docstrings
 * Remove start index 0 in range()
 * Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase

Change-Id: If0ecdeb5fefcef36bd14af5a46481cacf2580239

commit_message:
Support remote VM hosts in boot-seed-vm.

With the upcoming test cluster, we need the ability to boot seed VMs
that are stored on a remote machine. This involves copying the image
onto the machine, chattr +C'ing it and then calling virsh start with
an appropriate URI.

Change-Id: I6194ad94d96aec08105f11acfae61b674a6f15c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/18/63518/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VM_HOST="" echo " -r VM_HOST -- Use a VM on a remote host. This causes the image to" echo " be copied to that host via rsync, and a remote virsh" echo " URI to be used. VM_HOST can be an ssh [user@]host." echo " However SSH access with rsync write access to" echo " /var/lib/libvirt/images/, permission to chattr, and " echo " the ability to run virsh as the selected user are" echo " requirements."TEMP=`getopt -o hcia:o:r:s: -l ip: -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@"` -r) export VM_HOST=$2; shift 2 ;; if [ -n "$VM_HOST" ]; then rsync $IMAGE_CACHE_FILE.qcow2 ${VM_HOST}:/var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 ssh ${VM_HOST} chattr +C /var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 || true else sudo cp $IMAGE_CACHE_FILE.qcow2 /var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 sudo chattr +C /var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 || true fiif [ -n "$VM_HOST" ]; then # Different libvirts seem to use different URIs. Yay. export VIRSH_DEFAULT_CONNECT_URI=qemu+ssh://${VM_HOST}/system export LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI=qemu+ssh://${VM_HOST}/system virsh start $IMAGE_NAME else sudo virsh start $IMAGE_NAME fi
deleted_lines: TEMP=`getopt -o hcia:o:s: -l ip: -n $SCRIPT_NAME -- "$@"` sudo cp $IMAGE_CACHE_FILE.qcow2 /var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 sudo chattr +C /var/lib/libvirt/images/$IMAGE_NAME.qcow2 || truesudo virsh start $IMAGE_NAME

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer from the grenade gate

Ceilometer doesn't have a grenade upgrade script so if it is installed
by devstack on the old run then having the middleware in the pipeline
means the old version will also be imported on the new run. This can
lead to conflicting requirements.

Change-Id: Ifac7f5df5f6ac013b065e4dc4b582bee7a30d923
Closes-bug: #1262934

commit_message:
Nexenta iSCSI driver: use one iSCSI target and group config option

Adds special config option that force using single iSCSI target and
group for Cinder volumes created on NexentaStor appliance volume.

This helps users avoid NexentaStor appliance 255 iSCSI targets
limitiation.

Change-Id: Icb64989bc04deb0eaa5e57c77766ee6ec3e2a67f
